text: Buona Sera (sometimes titled Buona Sera, Signorina) is a song written by Carl Sigman and Peter de Rose and best known as performed by Louis Prima & His Orchestra in 1957. It reached #1 in the singles charts in Belgium, the Netherlands and Norway, and is ranked #3 on the all-time best-selling singles chart in Flanders between 1954 and 2014 as compiled by Ultratop. Ralf Bendix reached #5 in Germany with his recording of the same song in 1958. In the same year, Dean Martin recorded the song on his This is Dean Martin! album. Acker Bilk's version reached #7 in the UK in 1960. The song was used as the theme song for the second season of the TV series "Platane" by Éric Judor in 2013. ==Other versions== * Svend Asmussen, Denmark * Eddie Meduza, Sweden * Marcel Azzola, France * Al Bano, Italy * Bad Manners, UK, 1981 (#34 in UK singles chart) * Francis Bay with Freddy Sunder, Belgium * Alfie Boe, 2014 * Dick Brave, Germany * Patrizio Buanne, 2012 * Fred Buscaglione, Italy, 1958 * Adriano Celentano, Italy, 1958 * Emile Ford * The Gaylords, US, 1958 * Rocco Granata * André Hazes, Netherlands, 1985 * John Leyton * Marino Marini, Italy, 1958 * Van Morrison * Line Renaud, France, 1958 * Matteo Simoni, on the soundtrack of Marina (2013 film), 2013 * Vico Torriani, Switzerland * Olavi Virta, Finland, 1958 * Dean Martin, US ==References== Category:1950 songs Category:Number-one singles in Belgium Category:Number-one singles in the Netherlands Category:Number-one singles in Norway Category:Songs with music by Peter DeRose Category:Songs written by Carl Sigman
